jx.jx_en_mean: Available or ready for eating or other use.

jx.jx_en_mean: Legally permitted to be caught or hunted during a specified period.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French seson, from Latin satio(n-) 'sowing', later 'time of sowing', from the root of serere 'to sow'

encyclopedia.content: 乐器品牌：SEASON “SEASON”（思雅晨）系列是广州嘉谊轩乐器有限公司的自创品牌 ,乐器的生产溶入现代设计理念，并以造型新颖、工艺精细、演奏性能良好等优点而畅销欧美各国。 SEASON 思雅晨系列艺术吉他 集现代，时尚，个性，艺术为一体，并以造型新颖、工艺精细、演奏性能良好等优点而畅销欧美各国。 SEASON -思雅晨，花样年华系列艺术吉他是充满个性化的一个吉他品牌！丰富多彩的图案、款式，又拥有超高的性价比。在未来的吉他

entry.def: The seasons are the main periods into which a year can be divided and which each have their own typical weather conditions.

example.tran: 秋天是我最喜欢的季节。

example.ex: ...the only region of Brazil where all four seasons are clearly defined.
example.tran: 巴西唯一一个四季分明的地区

entry.tran: (一年中某项活动或某一事件发生的)节期，时期
entry.def: You can use season to refer to the period during each year when a particular activity or event takes place. For example, the planting season is the period when a particular plant or crop is planted.

example.tran: 飞来准备度过繁殖季节的鸟群

example.ex: For law students, autumn brings the recruiting season.
example.tran: 对学法律的学生来说，秋季是招聘旺季。

entry.tran: (水果、蔬菜等的)当令期，上市期
entry.def: You can use season to refer to the period when a particular fruit, vegetable, or other food is ready for eating and is widely available.

example.ex: The plum season is about to begin...
Now British asparagus is in season.

entry.def: You can use season to refer to a fixed period during each year when a particular sport is played.

example.ex: It is his first race this season.
example.tran: 这是他本赛季的第一场比赛。

entry.tran: (戏剧、表演的)上演期，会演期，献演期
entry.def: A season is a period in which a play or show, or a series of plays or shows, is performed in one place.

example.tran: 皇家芭蕾舞团的夏季献演期

entry.def: A season of films is several of them shown as a series because they are connected in some way.

example.ex: ...a brief season of films in which Artaud appeared.
example.tran: 阿尔托出演的系列影片的短暂上映期

entry.def: The holiday or vacation season is the time when most people have their holiday.

example.ex: There are discos and clubs but these are often closed out of season.
example.tran: 那里有迪斯科舞厅和夜总会，但是通常只在度假旺季营业。

entry.def: If you season food with salt, pepper, or spices, you add them to it in order to improve its flavour.

example.ex: Season the meat with salt and pepper...
example.tran: 用盐和胡椒粉给肉调味。

example.ex: I believe in seasoning food before putting it on the table.
example.tran: 我认为在把食物端上餐桌前应该先调味。

entry.tran: 对(木材)作干燥处理;风干，晒干(木材)
entry.def: If wood is seasoned, it is made suitable for making into furniture or for burning, usually by being allowed to dry out gradually.

example.ex: Ensure that new wood has been seasoned.

entry.def: If a female animal is in season, she is in a state where she is ready to have sex.

means.word_mean: 1. a period of the year marked by special events or activities in some field;

sentences.sentence: "he celebrated his 10th season with the ballet company"
"she always looked forward to the avocado season"

means.word_mean: 2. one of the natural periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices or atmospheric conditions;
3. a recurrent time marked by major holidays;

sentences.sentence: "Season the chicken breast after roasting it"
"This trip will season even the hardiest traveller"

means.word_mean: 3. make more temperate, acceptable, or suitable by adding something else; moderate;
